lesson.title_and_level: Intermediate - Beauty Pageant: It's a Mess

sentence.idiomatic: You continue speaking, we still want to listen.
If gas prices continue to rise I won't drive my car anymore.
Once we've finished lunch we will continue with the meeting.
I regret telling him about that.
I don't regret going to China to work for three years.
You will definitely regret breaking up with me.
I want to attend the spring outing the school has organized.
Will you attend tomorrow's sports meet?
I don't really like taking part in group activities.
He dotes on his daughter too much.
I don't think what I did is over the top at all.
He is too much. Not only does he curse at the person, he hit them too!
I can't give you up.
Only by persisting can you succeed. Don't give up halfway through.
He gave up a lot of relaxation time for his career.
She doesn't seem to be very happy, let's go cheer her up.
I would advise you not to wait, he won't come.
Don't tell me what to do, I know what I should do.
Shanghai's traffic system is very complex.
This map is too confusing, I can't understand it.
Complicated relationships with others are a real headache.
Summer is so hot it's hard to take.
I really can't take his bad temper.
The subway is too crowded, I can't take it.
I have decided to go to university in the United States.
Have you decided to marry him?
I still can't make up my mind about which house to rent.
Jiajia, what's the matter?
I don't want to continue with the competition.
These reporters are all writing made-up stuff. No one will believe them.
I get so upset. I really regret entering this contest.
Don't think like that, this is such a great opportunity!
If I continue on in the pageant, they'll probably write even worse things about me. I really don't want to compete.
Giving up would be such a shame!

word.literal: to be unable to bear it

sentence.idiomatic: Quit telling me what to do. You have no idea how ugly and messy a beauty pageant is. I can't take it anymore!
All right, you make the decision.
I have already decided.

word.literal: to be unable to bear it
